body:
Comment 7 by **cgmurray**: 
To me an interface value is conceptually no different from a pointer to a c++-instance
with a vtable or a java reference but I might be missing something crucial in go given
my limited experience with go.
I have a complete example with decomposing and reconstruction of interface-values in
order to implement weak-references in go. See the attached file.
I understand it's probably considerad bad and non-idiomatic go-code but it illustrates
that it's indeed possible to reconstruct an interface-value without
switch/case-statements or equivalent.

Btw, I really appreciate the swift response and all your efforts in making go a truly
remarkable language!

/Christian
Attachments: 1. weak.go (2012 bytes)
